issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description: See attached screenshot. Field currently does not mark "ffff' as invalid.
fields.summary: create snapshot volume field should accept only valid volumes from the drop down list or volume IDs that match something in the drop down list

comments.body: Add the fix to validate the volume id on the create snapshot dialog

validation message seems to switch back and forth randomly between "invalid volume ID" and "Volume ID is required" depending on how many keys you press and error message does not clear when text field is cleared.

The behavior is not random. The input box scans and validates the input string as being typed in, so even a single character "v" is first typed, it will be validated, which is "invalid volume id", but once the user selects the matching volume id on the autocomplete box, the message will get cleared out.

And, the error message "Volume ID is required" shows up when there is an empty input box, which should be the correct behavior for the volume ID will be needed in order for the dialog to initiate the snapshot creation.
[~jpommer] has implemented this correctly for other dialogs, I am sure he can offer some advice on how to do it.
It'd be easier if those dialogs with the correct autocomplete and validation behaviors can be referenced here so that I can replicate their behaviors on the create snapshot dialog.

Awesome. Will try to add the snippet above into the our current snapshot validation model.

Thank you!

Adjusted the input validation error display behaviors on the create snapshot dialog.

In order to match the described behavior, ended up disabling the backbone-side validation due to the circle dependency issue.

Rely on external volume ID validation on the dialog for now.
[~kyolee], can you describe in more detail the circular dependency problem you're talking about? I don't know of such a thing.

Ean can tell you in more details since he explained it to me the other day.

The issue appears that 'app' cannot be defined inside the snapshot model due to the dependency by 'app''s data, which includes the model definition itself.

when i type "v" in the volume field, I briefly see the "invalid volume ID" error message before the autocomplete dropdown drops down. That validation error message should not be displaying at that point.

In order to solve this issue, the validation process needs to be taken place through the backbone model only.

And, due to the circular dependency issue mentioned above, currently we do not have a way to validate the volume ID through the backbone built-in validation process.

For this reason, the validation of the volume ID is taking place outside, independently, which is why the error message gets displayed briefly after typing.

Once Jerry and Ean can sort of the circular dependency issue, we can try to merge the validation steps into a single place, which will eliminate the altering error messages.

Hi Jerry,

Tried to pull the branch team/console/EUCA-6865 and build the system from it, but it appears that the branch is checked in locally.

Would it be possible to push the branch into our git server so that I can build from it ?

Thank you!

Kyo

Hmm? 

$ git push origin EUCA-6865:team/console/EUCA-6865
Everything up-to-date

Looks okay, I see it in the list with 'git remote show origin'... do you?

Hi Jerry,

I just pulled your branch and checked it out. As emailed earlier, the issue was that you have only committed to "eucalyptus", thus "internal" does not recognize the new branch.

Your fix is working; it definitely simplified the code into the right direction. However, it doesn't solve what Jenny was pointing it out in the comment above.

When a key 'v' is typed in the inputbox, the error message immediately detects the new key and shows an error message "No match found", which was changed from "Invalid volume ID", but they mean the same.

Will further look into this issue.

Thank you!

Kyo

[~kyolee],

Yes, that live-typing validation is now being discussed. I haven't had a chance to think about how to have it both ways yet. As you know, the live typing is what enables the button as soon as validation passes, so you don't have to use the tab key or click some other field to get that button to go active. Tricky problem. All I can think of is find some way of suppressing the error message until three characters have been entered or something. Don't really like any of our choices so far.
Ah, awesome. Let us know what comes out of the discussion. That was definitely one of the issues that I was scratching my head on for sure :)

Fixed, validates on submit now, and only allows volume IDs from the list.

commit b920845f37fc41e4e73e3c7ff384fc7e5e80f1fb
